file_content.text: You're a real hero, Lieutenant. It's been an honor having you here.
Lieutenant! You made it! Please, have a seat, tell me what happened--was your mission against the Imperials a success?
I wiped them out.
Affirmative.
They ran like cowards.
Affirmative.
Fantastic! This is incredibly good news, Lieutenant--congratulations! You won!
I'm afraid that's classified.
Oh. Oh, uh, yes, of course. I understand. Top secret mission, of course.
Well, could you at least tell me about Fuse? I mean, did you rescue him from the Imperials?
Your worthless backwater town is safe now.
Yeah, so you can stop whining.
Always the cheerful one, aren't you? Come on, lighten up--you won! We should be celebrating!
So what about Fuse? Was he alright? Were you able to rescue him?
All of the details about Fuse are classified, I'm afraid.
I'm sorry, I can't tell you.
Shame. I really took a liking to him. Be nice to know if he made it out safe.
It was close, but I managed to save him.
I got Fuse out of there.
Oh, that's great! He seemed like a pretty decent guy, I'm glad he made it.
The Imperials escaped with the bomb designs while I was saving Fuse.
Fuse, yes, but no Gorik.
Then that murdering scum is still out there.
Well, I'm sure you did everything you could, Lieutenant. Maybe someday we'll track Gorik down and gut him like he deserves.
He gave his life so that I could stop Gorik.
Fuse didn't make it.
Oh. That's rough. He was a good guy, that one. Wish I could've shook his hand.
Fuse died the traitor's death that he earned back on Ord Mantell.
He got what he deserved.
Wow, you hated that poor guy. Seemed decent enough to me. Remind me never to get on your bad side.
So, your general called while you were gone. I filled her in on what I knew--nice lady. Stern, though.
General Garza is an exemplary officer.
She's a good CO.
She definitely seemed to know what's what. Comes with the job, I guess.
Don't get me started on General Garza.
"Stern" isn't the half of it.
It probably isn't good that you admitted knowing so much about my operation.
You shouldn't have talked.
I couldn't very well lie to the woman, could I? She's your boss, she needs to know what's happening.
Anyway, she wants you to call her from your ship before you take off. She was pretty insistent about it, actually. Hope nothing's wrong.
Post-mission debriefing--standard procedure.
I'm sure it's nothing.
Oh, good. Personally, I think I've had enough crises for three lifetimes.
There's no predicting with Garza.
Who knows?
You accomplished some great things here. I can't imagine she's anything but pleased.
If it's not one problem, it's another.
Something is always wrong.
I guess you wouldn't have much to do if there wasn't, huh?
Well, Lieutenant, the people of Anchorhead owe you an incredible debt. You've saved countless lives from a threat we never could've imagined.
I managed to scrape together a small reward for you. It's the least we could do to thank you.
I really appreciate it, Mayor Klerren.
Thank you very much.
Lieutenant, need I remind you once again that accepting personal compensation from civilians is against Code 497-A?
Lieutenant, Code 497-A is very clear. Accepting rewards of this nature is forbidden.
Accepting your reward would violate procedure. But thanks anyway, mayor.
You're right, Sergeant.
At this rate, we're going to have the best gear in the Republic. We should find more towns to save from imminent destruction.
Extra credits always come in handy. Never know when Command might start making cutbacks.
Ah, more kind donations to the cause of liberty and democracy! We are fortunate to have helped such generous people.
Generous donations like this are a great help to us when defending cities like yours from the vile oppression of the Empire, Mayor Klerren.
I'm just glad we could give you something for your hard work--especially if it helps you help more people down the line.
You hold on to it.
Well, that's generous of you, Lieutenant. I know the people affected by these bombings will really appreciate it.
I'm sure you could offer more than that.
That can't be all.
Lieutenant, we have no place accepting monetary compensation in the first place--let alone extorting local allies for more.
Additional funds will increase Havoc's combat effectiveness.
We need the money.
We're taking the reward, Sergeant. And that's final.
It isn't your call.
The decision is yours, sir, but it's still a violation of code.
Sorry, I didn't think it would be such a big deal. I just think that a good deed should be rewarded.
Whoa--let's not push it. Technically, we're breaking the rules by taking anything at all.
Keep the money, Klerren. You need it more than we do, anyway.
All right, forget the reward.
Well, if you're sure. Whatever the Republic's paying, it isn't enough for heroes like you.
This will be plenty, Mayor Klerren.
The original reward will do.
Think nothing of it, Lieutenant. I just wish we could do more.
We saved the entire town--I think that's worth more.
Let me do the talking, Jorgan.
A more generous donation could make the difference between a victory for liberty... or a terrible loss at the hands of vile oppression.
I, uh... I'm sorry. If I had more to give, I'd give it. No reward is big enough to repay what you've done.
So, I guess this is where we part ways. It's been a real pleasure having you here, Lieutenant. An honor. We'll never forget what you've done for us.
The Republic prides itself on protecting the innocent.
Just doing my duty.
Well, be sure the Republic knows how much we appreciate the help.
I can pose for a statue, if you need me to.
That's what I like to hear.
Hah! Well, we'll see how the rebuilding goes. Maybe we'll take you up on that.
Good luck, Lieutenant. You'll always be welcome in Anchorhead.
Good, because I'm out of here.
Well, all the same, you'll always be welcome in Anchorhead, soldier. Goodbye.
What are you doing here, Lieutenant? You've got to hurry to the Imperial base, before that scrag-eater Gorik escapes!
That scum killed dozens of innocent people for his "tests". Those people deserve justice. Their families deserve justice.
Please hurry, Lieutenant--Gorik has to pay for what he's done.
I'll move out immediately, sir.
Roger that.
That Imp scum won't get away from me.
Don't worry, I'll stop him.
You've got him on the run--now finish him off!
I'd already be there by now if you weren't distracting me.
Shut up and I'll go.
Okay, I get it, fine. I'll let you do your job.
Good luck, Lieutenant. Klerren, uh, Klerren out. Err, right.
Lieutenant--Lieutenant, can you hear me? This is Oleg Klerren. Are you there, Lieutenant?
Yes, sir.
Has something come up?
What can I do for you?
Not now, Klerren.
Fuse just called. He said Colonel Gorik is pulling out. He's going to run for it, Lieutenant!
Find those Imperials, Lieutenant. Find them and make them pay for what they've done.
Colonel Gorik is... well, he isn't pleased about you being here, Lieutenant. He has the entire operation on high alert.
Will the alert become a problem for our plans?
How does this affect us?
I, uh, I think it's actually going to help us.
The colonel is right to be scared.
Smart man.
Yeah, I'd say so.
I think it's time for you to tell me where you are, Fuse.
And where is this operation?
Well, I would, but, uh, but there's a problem.
See, the base's location is a total secret. I have no idea where we are.
The only people who have the base's coordinates are Gorik's commando teams. You'll, uh, you'll have to hit one of those teams to get the coordinates.
Understood.
Just point me in the right direction and I'll move out.
Where are these commandos?
There's got to be an easier way.
This is much too complicated.
I'm sorry, but, uh... but there's really no other way to find this place.
When the guards were talking earlier, I, uh, I overheard them mention a commando team stationed in a cave near the Sand People's settlements.
The commandos were deployed to test some of my designs on the Sand People--mines, booby traps, that kind of thing. So, the Sand People are, you know, pretty riled up right now.
Copy that.
Sounds like fun.
I'm basically committing suicide by going out there, is that about right?
So this is a death trap.
Well, it might be suicidal for anybody else. But not for you.
It, uh, it may not be long before Gorik decides to pull out entirely, Lieutenant. He's worried that more Republic reinforcements are coming.
So try to reach the cave and get the coordinates off of the commandos quickly, before the opportunity is gone.
Good luck out there. You'll need it.
I'm so, so sorry, Mayor Klerren. I, uh... I just, I never imagined it would come to this, you know?
Innocent people dead, all because of my designs. I... I was so stupid.
Well, you're working for the right side now, okay, buddy? We're going to put a stop to this.
I'm back.
I heard, Lieutenant, it's fantastic news! Congratulations!
The Geonosians were definitely working with the Imps.
Fuse was telling us the truth.
I know it's... well, thanks for trusting me, after everything that's happened. I really do want to help.
Fuse may seem like your buddy now, but that doesn't make it true.
Don't let him fool you, mayor.
I'm pretty sure he's being straight with us, Lieutenant. I heard you found the Geonosians just like he said.
She, uh, she didn't just find them. She wiped them out.
He, uh, he didn't just find them. He wiped them out.
I hope those Geonosians don't send more bomb droids while you're gone, Lieutenant.
Excuse me, Mayor Klerren? I'm sorry to interrupt, sir, but we have an urgent holocall--someone who claims to have vital information about the bomber's identity.
What? Really? Put him through, Cohn.
Ah! Uh, hello there, Mayor Klerren, sir. My name is Vanto Bazren, and I have vital information for you regarding--
I'm sorry, is that... Sergeant, is that you? It's me, Fuse! From Ord Mantell, remember?
How could I forget?
Yeah, I remember.
Advanced bombs like these could only come from one man.
I knew it.
Bombs as advanced as these... I can't believe I didn't put it together sooner.
I should've known.
Look, I, uh... this, this isn't what you think it is. Not, not exactly.
I remember Ord Mantell, Fuse. And I'm here to make you pay for it.
I never forget a traitor.
I... I'm sorry. I--I don't know what I was thinking.
I know, uh, you might not believe this, but... I'm really, really glad you're here. If anyone can shut down the Imps and stop the bombings in Anchorhead, it's you.
I'm here for you, Fuse. Nothing else.
I'm not here for Imperials.
I, uh, I thought as much, but please, hear me out, okay? We can't let the Imps get away with this.
You're betraying the Empire and helping the Republic again?
So you're back on our side?
Yes. Please, please trust me. With my help, you can stop them!
Pointless flattery won't make me trust you, Fuse.
What twisted game is this?
What? I... no, no, please, you don't understand. It--it's not like that.
Lieutenant, who is this guy? Can he really help us stop the bombings?
I cannot discuss this individual or my mission, sir.
That's classified information.
Let's hear what the man has to say.
We're about to find out.
Thanks. I have to hurry, they... well, if I'm caught transmitting, it'll be bad. Really bad.
This man is a traitor to the Republic. Don't trust a word he says.
No, this is all a lie.
Please, I--I don't have much time. If they catch me transmitting, they'll, uh... it won't be good.
The Imperials brought me here to design bombs. Desert planet, middle of nowhere, makes sense, right?
Then Colonel Gorik, the Imp leader, wants to test the bombs. But he wouldn't use the empty deserts--he wanted a live testing ground. He chose Anchorhead.
That son-of-a... he's killing innocent people just to test your damned bombs?
That's the Empire for you.
Despicable.
Not every Imperial officer is a murderous psychopath, but still. Yeah. Pretty horrible.
You're assuming that Fuse is telling the truth.
According to this traitor.
Why would I lie? Why would I call you at all unless I wanted to help, right? It--it wouldn't make sense.
This is a Republic military matter. It doesn't concern you.
Stay out of it, Klerren.
My citizens have been murdered by the dozens, and you expect me to stay out of it?
As soon as I found out... I told Gorik I wouldn't do it. Never. So his men locked me up in here.
Gorik's afraid of Tavus, or he would've just killed me. Only you can stop Gorik now. Let me help you--let me tell you who's putting the bomb droids together.
My objective is to capture you, not to destroy droids.
That's irrelevant.
And I'll help you find Gorik's base and turn myself in--as soon as I know those droids won't hurt anyone else.
Why doesn't Gorik construct the droids himself?
The Empire doesn't build them?
He doesn't have the resources. So he hired on some help.
Let's hear it.
A group of Geonosians is building the bomb droids. When each batch is finished, they're sent to coordinates that Gorik provides.
The Geonosians are holed up somewhere outside Anchorhead, but I don't know the exact location. Guards are coming now--I have to hide the transmitter before I'm caught. Fuse out.
Got it.
Look, Lieutenant--I don't know the whole story, granted, but I think he was telling us the truth.
Fuse, get back on this line!
Get back here!
He's gone, Lieutenant. We'll have to work the rest out without him.
Do you know anything about these Geonosians, Mayor Klerren?
What was he talking about?
The Geonosians Fuse mentioned--a big gang of them--moved into an abandoned town nearly two months ago.
They haven't been a problem--no worse than scavengers. We... we never imagined they were involved in the bombings.
Sounds like I'm paying these guys a visit.
Only one way to find out.
Can you tell me anything about these people?
Who are the Geonosians?
Well, they aren't exactly people, for starters--they're creepy insectoids with a knack for tech. I can't believe I didn't think of them before.
If you ask me, it's all just a trap.
I still don't buy any of this.
I don't see that we have any choice but to investigate, Lieutenant. Think of how many lives you'll be saving if Fuse is right!
If you kill the Geonosians' leader, it should put a stop to all of this. But there are so many--getting in won't be easy.
I'll be back when the job is done.
Leave that to me.
Havoc Squad can handle anything.
Leave that to us.
You're starting to sound more like a soldier than a mayor.
Now you're talking.
I'm not sure if that's a compliment, but thanks.
You don't think we should try to talk this one out, mayor?
What, no negotiations?
If you think you can talk them down, be my guest. But if what Fuse said is true, then I'm not interested in a peaceful resolution.
Good luck out there, Lieutenant.
I stopped the bombings. There were no casualties beyond the initial blast.
You really did it? Thank you, Lieutenant. Thank you so much. The city of Anchorhead owes you a great debt.
Please hurry. You're the only one who can stop this!
I am so thankful that you're here. Please, Lieutenant, I need your help. My city--the people of Anchorhead--need your help.
I'm sorry, but I have to put my mission first.
I already have an assignment.
Please, my city--we really aren't prepared for things like this.
What's going on?
I'm not here to help you, you're here to help me.
Your people aren't my problem.
My duty is to the people of Anchorhead--not to you. My people come first.
Someone is attacking us, Lieutenant. Bombs have been going off all over Anchorhead--more than a dozen just in the past week.
And we have no idea who's behind them--no threats, no demands or warnings. Innocent people are being murdered without any explanation!
I'm afraid my duty to the Republic has to come first, sir.
I'm sorry, but I can't help.
Has there been any pattern to the bombings?
What else can you tell me?
Not that we can tell. Storefronts, cantinas, warehouses--all sorts of places have been hit.
The victims of the attacks are innocent bystanders. There doesn't seem to be any particular target.
Jorgan, isn't one of our objectives a bomb expert?
Sounds like someone I know.
That's a big affirmative, Lieutenant. He pulled some pretty flashy stuff back on Ord Mantell, if memory serves.
Dorne, one of our objectives is a bomb expert, correct?
Sounds like someone I know.
Affirmative, Lieutenant--according to the personnel files I've reviewed, one of the most skillful in the galaxy.
Forex, we've got a bomb expert on our list of targets, don't we?
Sounds like someone I know.
Affirmative--records indicate one of the top bomb experts in the galaxy, and a vile and heartless traitor besides.
Really? Do you think our problems might be related, then? If you find this bomb expert....
So what?
Please, Lieutenant--under any other circumstances, helping a representative from the Republic would be my top priority.
But my people are dying! It's my duty to put their lives first. Help me save them, and I swear to help you any way I can.
Sir! Mayor Klerren, sir! There's been another bombing! An apartment building, over in district seven!
Oh, no. No, no. How--how many? Do we know yet?
No, sir, but it's going to be bad. A lot of people lived in the building... a lot of families.
I'll proceed to the scene at once, Mayor Klerren.
Leave this to me.
I'll lend a hand, but I have to know you'll assist me in my mission afterward, Mayor Klerren.
You'll help me if I help you?
Anything you need, anything!
We've got work to do. You can grieve all you want later.
Stop moping and act.
I look into this, then you help me with my mission--is that how this is going to work?
I guess you expect me to help.
Yes. If you want my help, you have to help my people first.
After the first explosion, there are always more, all in the same area. If you hurry, you might get there in time to stop them!
Please, Lieutenant--protect my people, and I'll do anything I can to help your mission. Please, hurry!
...That puts the tally somewhere around sixty-four, sir. But we've still got some volunteers digging through the rubble to be sure.
Sixty-four. So... so many. So much death. And for what? Why is this happening? What have we done to deserve this?
We still don't have any leads, sir, but I'm sure--excuse me, who are you? This is the mayor's office; you can't just barge in here without an appointment!
I'm a soldier. The mayor knows I'm coming.
The mayor is expecting me.
You must be the lieutenant--the one General Garza told me about.
Be sure to let the mayor know that you turned away the commander of Havoc Squad.
Fine, then, I'll go.
No! Wait, please!
Don't get in my way, kid.
It's alright, Cohn. This is the Republic soldier I told you about--the one that general called about.
Hello. Welcome to Anchorhead.
